node.title: COVID vaccine to be rolled out to children aged five to 11 from early January
node.alt: A health practitioner administers a vaccine to a teenage girl.
node.description: The nationwide rollout of COVID-19 vaccines to Australian children aged between 5 and 11 will begin early next year, the federal government says, but there will be key differences to the rollout for adults.
node.content:
["The nationwide rollout of COVID-19 vaccines to children aged between five\u00a0and 11 will begin early next year.", "The federal government has confirmed the rollout will begin on January 10, after vaccine advisory group ATAGI provided its recommendations.", "More than 2 million children will become eligible for the vaccine, further extending vaccine coverage across the Australian population.", "Children will initially receive the Pfizer vaccine, however Moderna is also seeking approval to join the rollout.", "While children generally feel only mild COVID-19 symptoms, there is a risk of severe disease or long-term complications from the virus.", "Health Minister Greg Hunt said the government would strongly recommend\u00a0children were\u00a0vaccinated.", "\"Australians can be reassured that by vaccinating their children against COVID-19 they have done everything possible to keep their child safe from this virus,\" he said.", "\"Vaccinating children can also help reduce community transmission and help prevent children passing the virus on to younger siblings, grandparents and the wider community.", "Bookings will open in late December, and vaccinations are expected to be available through state and territory clinics, GPs, pharmacies and Aboriginal Health Services.", "
Some differences in children's rollout
", "There will be some key differences in how the vaccine is rolled out to children, compared to the rollout to adults and teenagers this year.", "Children will wait much longer between their two doses of the Pfizer vaccine.", "While adults are recommended to wait three weeks between their doses, ATAGI is recommending children wait eight weeks.", "The decision is based on new clinical data from Canada.", "The interval can still be shortened to three weeks in special circumstances, such as\u00a0a significant outbreak.", "The actual doses of the vaccine will be much smaller too, exactly one-third the size administered to adults. They will be labelled differently to adult doses.", "Last Sunday the Therapeutic Goods Administration provisionally approved\u00a0Pfizer's vaccine for children aged five to 11, suggesting the most common side effects in kids tended to be mild\u00a0and similar to those in adults.", "Prime Minister Scott Morrison said parents could\u00a0have confidence the vaccine was safe.", "\"They can have peace of mind knowing this has the tick from the best medical regulators in the world.\"", "A number of other countries, particularly\u00a0in North America, Europe and the Middle East, are expected to begin vaccinating\u00a0children soon.", "The United States commenced its rollout last month, with roughly 5\u00a0million children having already received\u00a0their first dose.", "", "
Why we hear about some COVID-19 variants more than others
"]
